other_tests.findings: Bilateral lower lobe atelectasis. No evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion. The gallbladder is within normal limits. The pancreas has normal attenuation. The spleen shows normal size and attenuation. The kidneys are of normal and symmetric size. There is a stable 1.3 cm left renal cyst. Colonic wall thickening involving the transverse, descending and sigmoid colon, unchanged to mildly worsened compared to prior. Increased diameter, thickening and hyperemia of the wall of the appendix measuring 1.6 cm in diameter.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The appendix measured 1.0 cm without thickening or hyperemia previously. It was dilated up to 1.3 cm on a prior exam but did not show increased wall thickness or hyperenhancement.
